comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here are the companion pics - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... ; investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... Over at NSW Transport RMS they have a different pic of this group taken the same day, which has accompanying captions. I can't yet work out how to link to it. I suspect a carrier pigeon is required. In the interim, this gets you to their front door www.rtaphotolibrary.com.au/fotoweb/ then search for this pic 19281026HB34210.jpg R.T. Ball was a NSW MLA. He was NSW Secretary for Public Works in the period 1922-1925 and had been involved in the early stages of the Harbour Bridge project. At the time this pic was taken he was Minister for Agriculture. He features in many of the Harbour Bridge pics taken during the early stages of construction (whilst he was Secretary for Public Works)...and as an engineer he would have had a continuing interest in the project. The SLNSW has a good pic of him in action laying the foundation stone acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=44267 ; here's his NSW Parliament web-site snapshot www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... ; T.R. Bavin was the then NSW Premier - www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... ; E.A. Buttenshaw was a NSW MLA, and the then Secretary for Public Works - www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6e... Frank Litchfield was a senior NSW Public Works Dept engineer. He features in many of the official pics taken whilst the Harbour Bridge was under construction. Anyone want to try identifying the bloke in overalls over to the rhs?
